name: Recursion Deluxe
description: A crash landing on a world inhabited by bee-like lifeforms. Stranded, our hero must unravel the rules of this uncharted planet to find their way home.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP2, Vista, 7, 8, 10 or newer Processor: SSE2 instruction set support Graphics: GPU with DX9 (shader model 2.0) capabilities; generally everything made since 2004 should work. Storage: 50 MB available space

reviews.review_text: I won this game in a stream giveaway and I've played the game for awhile and it's quite fun. You might not become addicted to it but it's a very entertaining game and the puzzels get you thinking a bit at times.  Also did I mention the game has faces on the rocks and clouds? I think that's enough reason already to play the game.

Don't be fooled by the simple retro graphical style, this is no run-of-the-mill platformer, it is genuinely fun, has some really nice gameplay ideas and really good level design that actually makes you think. The music is inkeeping with the style and not too annoying. If I had one bone to pick it would be the placement of the restart button (sometimes you'll hit it accidentally right when you're about to win a really difficult level). But definitely recommend!

Retro graphics and old skool super addictive puzzle platformer. It gets so frustratingly annoying you just have to beat the level! Great work 2D Heroes and Ursa Games.  Being able to mod the game adds more longevity and the chance to unleash your creative side. Can you design the ultimate level to frustrate your friends?  I recommend you purchase this as it's the Civilization equivalent of the puzzle platformer genre, just ONE more go!
This game is really fun, when your bored and tired this game is perfect, it helps clear your mind and be happy, I give it 10/10. the creators of this game have done a great job :D
